meanings.definition: Opposed to or against the values or beliefs of the middle class.
meanings.sent1: The artist's work was considered antibourgeois because it challenged traditional middle-class ideas.
meanings.sent2: She always wore unique clothes, which some saw as antibourgeois.
meanings.sent3: The cat's refusal to use the fancy bed was almost antibourgeois in nature.
meanings.sent4: His minimalist lifestyle was a statement of his antibourgeois stance.
meanings.sent5: The rebellious teenager proudly displayed his antibourgeois attitude by refusing to conform.

meanings.definition: A person or group that rejects or opposes middle-class norms or conventions.
meanings.sent1: The artist became known as an antibourgeois for his unconventional views on society.
meanings.sent2: The antibourgeois at the party stood out with their unconventional attire.
meanings.sent3: The antibourgeois in the group always brought a unique perspective to discussions.
meanings.sent4: She was seen as an antibourgeois by her peers due to her rejection of mainstream culture.
meanings.sent5: The antibourgeois group organized events that challenged societal norms and expectations.
